Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the finance, marketing, and product teams, your focus will be on deriving insights from the group data warehouse to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize our technology stack (Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, and Superset) to derive insights from the group data warehouse.
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and actionable insights.
Build visualizations and storytelling frameworks to present data in an engaging and understandable manner.
Understand and analyze core e-commerce KPIs to support business objectives.
Ensure data stewardship and the delivery of accurate and reliable data analysis.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



Bonus Skills / If you know some of this, even better


Experience using Python, specifically creating Airflow DAGs.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control (GIT).



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we have got you interested and you are open to taking the next step, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Full-time (40 hrs per week), Remote

About Us:

At The Global Talent Co., we provide opportunities to work with leading innovative technology companies worldwide, offering stable employment, competitive compensation, career growth, and access to a community of 25k+ like-minded marketing professionals.

This role is with an EU based innovative, rapidly growing company in the nail polish industry, offering high-quality products for discerning customers worldwide. They are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their team.

As a Junior Data Analyst in their fast-growing startup, you’ll have the opportunity to indulge your passion for data analysis and actively shape the future of data-driven decision-making. They are looking for committed individuals who want to grow with them.

Responsibilities:


Data Warehouse Management: Develop, maintain, and optimise data warehouses to ensure efficient and accurate data storage and retrieval.
Dashboard Creation & Maintenance: Design and maintain dashboards to provide clear and actionable insights for various teams within the organisation.
Cross-Team Communication: Collaborate with different teams to understand their data needs and visualise these requirements in effective dashboards.


Requirements:


Entry Level (1-2 years experience).
Studying or having completed a degree in Computer Science.
Proficient in programming languages such as SQL (very important) and Python (nice to have).
Familiarity with Data Warehouses like Snowflake, BigQuery, Postgres, or Data Lake.
Experience with data tools such as dbt (good signal).
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Metabase, Holistics, or PowerBI.
Strong communication skills to explain data insights to non-technical team members.
Ability to identify and meet the data needs of various teams.
Previous experience as a Consultant in Data Analytics, Data Warehouse, or Business Intelligence is highly desirable.
Fluent in English
Available to work full-time in the same time zone as our primary business operations (GMT/UTC +2)


Join our team and be part of a collaborative and innovative environment where your skills and expertise will make a real impact. We offer competitive compensation, professional development opportunities, and a supportive team culture. Apply now and take the next step in your career!

At The Global Talent Co., our mission is to bridge the gap between leading global tech companies and amazing global talent. We believe everyone deserves equal access to opportunities, regardless of the country they are born in.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description


Ri5e is an innovative company based in Berlin, Germany. Our mission is to empower early-stage success by transforming visions into reality. We offer expertise in design, engineering, marketing, investment, and education to help businesses thrive.


Role Description


This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Analyst at Ri5e. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, conducting statistical analysis, and creating data models. They will also be responsible for effectively communicating insights and findings to stakeholders.


Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics proficiency
Strong communication skills
Experience in data modeling
Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
Experience with data visualization tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field

Company Description

Role Description

  • Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics proficiency
  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience in data modeling
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
  • Experience with data visualization tools is a plus

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making and support the continuous improvement of our operations and services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, data modeling, and statistical analysis, with a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Independently analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights, framing problems correctly, cleaning, and interpreting data sets.
Structure complex analytical CTEs in modeling pipelines using advanced SQL techniques, including window functions.
Develop reliable and accurate analytical workflows using DBT to create analytics models.
Apply statistical and analytical methods confidently to generate insights on specific issues or domain problems.
Develop efficient tracking concepts, extend existing events and attributes, and proactively resolve tracking issues.
Manage the delivery of technical stories by collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, supporting data literacy initiatives.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, creating understandable summaries of reports.
Influence stakeholders by working on dashboards with company/department-wide impact, ensuring stakeholder engagement for realizing value.


ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for advanced data modeling, experience with DBT for creating analytics models, and familiarity with statistical analysis methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and propose relevant metrics.
Good understanding of the current domain or the ability to quickly acquire expertise and fluency in the domain.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams, sharing knowledge and supporting junior team members.
Detailed knowledge of data sources within the immediate domain and support for data literacy initiatives within the company.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Blinkist connects people with powerful ideas from leading authors and experts to broaden perspectives, gain knowledge, and spark understanding in all areas of their life, both personal and professional.

Used by over 28 million people worldwide, Blinkist distills the key ideas from the most relevant, impactful books and podcasts. These can be read or listened to in 15-minute summaries, that we call Blinks.

Together with Go1, our parent brand, who gives organizations and their employees access to the largest curated e-learning library on the planet, we're on a mission to reach one billion learners as we unlock positive potential through a love of learning. ✨

About The Role

The next chapter of our growth story needs YOU!

Do you love to work at the intersection of culture and technology? Do you believe that it should be easy for customers to get inspired by captivating and powerful ideas?

Blinkist and Go1 provide curated content that unlocks positive potential for countless people and organizations around the world. We're endlessly curious, collaborative, and inspired by life-long learning. Although we have different backgrounds, we share the same vision; to reach a billion learners as we unlock positive potential through a love of learning. We owe it all to our people. Every win… every idea… every extra mile. They've made us who we are. And there's so much still to do – so much opportunity for you to own. Together, we're on a path to improving a billion lives and a culture where everyone can thrive.

As a Data Analyst you'll accelerate our global growth. With our team located primarily in Germany, you'll shape the future of our analytics landscape, introduce new approaches and enable our Sales, Product and Content leadership to make the right decisions on behalf of our global customers.

A few notes on the position:


Check out the interview process here: https://jobs.blinkist.com/5j7
You can work in a hybrid setup from our offices in Berlin or Paris, or fully remote within Germany, France or the UK. We can only hire candidates who are based in these countries and already have the legal right to work there.


What You Will Do


Closely collaborate with our marketing, product and content org to understand their most important business questions and use data to consult on the best course of action
Generate impact in the field of analytics/data by applying state-of-the-art data solutions to business challenges
Work on both a B2C and B2B business model
Navigate sales and retention funnels to enable better decision-making and increase the effectiveness of our customer support team
Gain understanding of customer behavior with our content offering in order to make great engagement and/or content suggestions to business stakeholders
As part of the Data Team, you'll advocate for a test & learn culture and encourage our stakeholders to make meaningful bets that help us to succeed in the long run


What You Need To Have


3+ years of relevant experience in the fields of Analytics or Data Science
Your strong abilities to handle big data with SQL and Python / R allow you to translate data into actionable insights quickly
You've got an excellent business understanding (B2B business models is a plus).
It's easy for you to identify and highlight opportunities for improvement across various business functions
A track record of delivering impact through actionable data insights and/or products
A strong understanding of either sales funnels or content engagement allows you to be an eye level sparring partner to our business stakeholders
You love to learn and develop yourself. You bring a passion to learn which allows you to flourish in a unicorn startup environment aiming to leverage state-of-the art tools and processes to fulfill our vision
Strong writing and fluent English language skills that allow you to synthesize complex context into concise, actionable text for non-technical audience
You're an absolute team player who likes to collaborate with your peers in the Data Analytics & Data Science team as well as business stakeholders
You're open to occasional business trips to our local office for team building & strategy meet-ups (not more than once per quarter for a week) and rare trips to Berlin (Germany).
You are willing to work across time zones and make flexible work hours work for you and your stakeholders


Why Blinkist/Go1

What makes Blinkist/Go1 special? Every one of our employees. When we work together, great things happen! When you join the team, you not only get to work with an outstanding bunch of people, but you're also supported to continue your own personal growth and development in an inclusive and flexible environment, with benefits including:

These are some of our most valued benefits:


Competitive incentive plan in addition to salary
Employee Stock Option Plan
Flexible approach to work
Monthly work from home or transport reimbursement
One time work from home office set up budget
Unlimited access to the Go1 Learning Hub, and mentorship program
Professional development fund
Volunteer leave to give back to the community
30 PTO days + Wellbeing days
Flexible public holidays - take the days off that are important to you, swap out the ones that are not
Family planning & parental leave, plus support for parents returning to work
Wellness initiatives and an Employee Assistance Program


If you choose to join our team in Berlin, you'll have access to our modern office space in Neukölln and enjoy healthy plant-based meals prepared fresh every day by our very own chef. 🥑

Apply Now

If we've captured your interest and you want to take part in changing the world through the power of ideas – apply now and tell us what got you excited about this opportunity.

We look forward to hearing from you! ☀️

🔎 Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, even if you don't meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Information on how we process your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy: Blinkist Privacy Policy (English) / Blinkist Privacy Policy (German)

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more
HTML:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.


IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

  • Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
  • Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
  • Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
  • Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
  • Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen



WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
  • Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
  • Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

  • Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
  • Teamspirit und Diversität
  • Work-Life-Balance
  • Attraktive Vergütung
  • Sozialleistungen
  • Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Team- und Sportevents
  • Globales Netzwerk
  • Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm



Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.


Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.


Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place – from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.

Your role


Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role


Your profile


BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English


We offer


Remote Work: Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility: Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team: We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future: You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay: For your remote job you'll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding: Your team members Lucas and Rémy will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning. Here you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year: Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing: Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.


Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you.

Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.
Show more

Title: Junior BI Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Build the future with Enter.

Our mission is to decarbonize homes by making home retrofits easy and accessible for everyone! We've raised 20 Mio. € from top-tier investors like COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global to make a carbon neutral home reality. Enter allows homeowners to make the best decision regarding the energy efficiency of their homes.

We Believe In


Working software over comprehensive documentation.
Responding to change over following a plan.
Embracing mistakes over avoiding them.
Full ownership over full control.
Simplicity and focus over completeness.


We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Within Enter’s analytics team your role as the Junior BI Analyst will be supporting the team in planning, building and maintaining the dashboards we rely on in our strategic decision making as well as to provide adhoc analyses we need in our day to day processes. You will work closely with other BI Analysts to build on the foundations of our BI processes, craft and improve data models, build dashboards, and set the trajectory for our data-driven future.

Your mission


Craft Business-Centric Data Models: As an integral part of Enter's analytics team, you'll feel responsible for all layers of data modeling, from raw to refined.
KPI Blueprinting & Deployment: Ideate, define, and establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for different Business domains in collaboration with our business stakeholders and team members in the Analytics team and implement through clear and intelligent data products.
Transform Data to Decisions: Combine the structured data models with KPIs to build and maintain expansive reports and dashboards that drive strategic and operational business decisions through cutting edge technologies.
Elevate the Data Discourse: Help foster data literacy within Enter. By equipping teams with the knowledge and tools they need, enhancing the data driven culture and put data to the centre of decisions.
Hands-On Collaboration & Innovation: While you'll primarily be immersed in the world of BI, your collaboration with the data engineering team and hands-on work where possible ensures that the data models are cohesive, coherent, and capable of catering to both granular analysis and high-level insights. Your expertise will constantly bridge the gap between raw data and refined intelligence.


In this capacity, you'll be entrusted with the autonomy to innovate, drive changes, and make impactful contributions. You will take ownership for your projects and ensure the successful implementation. With the freedom to innovate and a team to harmonize with, your contributions as the junior BI Analyst will reshape how Enter perceives, processes, and proceeds with data.

Your profile


You have a degree in the field of Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Informatics or similar.
You have done at least one internship in an Analytics related role, ideally in a growth phase of the company/team or the strong ambition to join a growing area.
You are motivated to dive into the world of data and expand your analytics skills quickly.
You enjoy working in a collaborative environment and work with others to ensure the insight your are creating are actionable, relevant, and aligned with business needs.
Previous experience with BI tools and databases, especially within data warehouses like Snowflake and transformation tools like DBT is a plus.
You possess profound analytical skills, ideally underlined through previous experience in driving and owning projects from conceptualisation through to production.
Stellar communication skills, delivering your actionable data insights clearly to your stakeholders
A solution-centric mindset, underscored by an autonomous work ethic, directly impacting business departments with work that matters.


Benefits


Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Corporate Pension for your safe future.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.


Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.
Show more

Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.
Show more

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: People Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Back to list People Data Analyst (f/m/d)Your role

As a People Data Analyst at Forto, you will be at the forefront of transforming our People function through data-driven insights and strategic analysis. In this key role, you will collect, analyze, and interpret data related to key metrics such as employee recruitment, engagement, performance, and retention. You will engage with dynamic cross-functional teams, and work closely with colleagues across both Asia and Europe to implement effective people strategies that support our business objectives. Your work will directly influence strategic decision-making and help shape the future of our organization.

You will


Collect, manage, and analyze all employment-related data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to employee demographics, performance, engagement, retention, and other key metrics;
Develop and maintain people metrics for regular reporting and ad hoc analysis, presenting findings to key stakeholders across the company;
Provide data-driven insights to assist in workforce planning, productivity measures, and performance/talent management programs;
Support all people-related projects and processes by leveraging comprehensive data analysis;
Collaborate closely with Finance, People Business Partners, People Operations, and Forto’s People Leadership to ensure alignment and integration of people analytics with broader business strategies;
Lead and support People analytics projects, ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of insights;
Monitor and evaluate the impact of implemented People initiatives and strategies, making recommendations for improvements based on data-driven insights;
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in People analytics and data management to continually enhance the effectiveness of people analytics at Forto.



What you bring


3 to 5 years of experience in People analytics, preferably in a fast-paced, growth-oriented company;
Strong analytical skills with hands-on experience in People data management;
Proven ability to translate data and trends into actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders;
Exceptional stakeholder management and relationship-building skills;
Strong communication skills, both written and oral;
Ability to advise and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders across an organization with 40+ nationalities in Europe and Asia;
A proactive, can-do attitude with a builder mentality;
Comfortable taking ownership of projects and driving them from inception to completion.



Forto Is An Internationally Growing Company


Company language: English
17+ offices across Europe & Asia
800+ employees
30+ nationalities represented
2500+ customers



Read more about us

Team:


At our core, we are in love with progress and cannot cope with the standstill.
We are constantly striving for ways to be even better tomorrow. We are facilitators, we are explorers, we are visionaries.
Forto provides a sense of belonging, where everyone has equal access to opportunities, career advancement and recognition. It stands for a workplace where people from all walks of life, with diverse perspectives and experiences can do their best work, while being their authentic selves. That’s why we encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ages, races, religions, and abilities to apply for our opportunities!



Work Life:


Experience a company culture where we work on eye level and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring is on our daily agenda.
We love our work and tackling business challenges but also believe in the importance of having a healthy balance with our personal life. That's why we appreciate a flexible work setup that fits around family, friends, and physical health.
We have the freedom to work in a hybrid setup.



Company Offering:


Sustainability Team
Emission Offsetting
Green Energy
Organic Food
Paperless Office
Inspiring Office Spaces
Flexible Working Hours
Team & Company Events
Hybrid Work
Peer Learning Program
Mentorship Program
Leadership Training
L&D Budget
Best Onboarding Program
Visa & Relocation Support
Remote Onboarding
Buddy Program

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we’re only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.
Show more

Title: IIoT Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Factory Pal

IIoT & Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0? Join us and be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize manufacturing process to improve shopfloor performance!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up, poised to become the leading end to end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping, how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but at the same time is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their jobs.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:

Data Transformation and Analysis
Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.

Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting
Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.

Stakeholder Management & Product Development
Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customers’ machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPal’s analytics solution.

Your Experience & Skills

Bachelor or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
>2 years experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (first experience with dbt is a plus)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code and collaboration
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent

What You Get

Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access of our mother company Körber
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
[Porto] Our inspiring Porto office that serves as technology hub for the entire Körber group
[Berlin] Our amazing Berlin office in the AI Campus with access to Berlin’s AI ecosystem
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment with great colleagues
A competitive salary & benefits package and dedicated training budget

Show more

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Junior Controller / Data Analyst
Description:
Die Havelland Express Frischdienst GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches mittelständisches Unternehmen, das die gehobene Hotellerie und Gastronomie mit Lebensmitteln beliefert. Als Vollsortimenter bieten wir unseren Kunden eine große Auswahl an frischen und tiefgekühlten Produkten. Von unserem Geschäftssitz in Berlin Tempelhof aus beliefern wir unsere Kunden in ganz Deutschland, Polen, Tschechien und im Baltikum.

Zur Verstärkung unseres hochmotivierten Teams suchen wir per sofort an unserem Standort Berlin in Vollzeit eine/n Junior Controller*in / Data Analyst, (m/w/d)

Aufgaben


Analyse von internen und externen Daten zur Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzialen
Überwachung der Preis- und Erlösentwicklung
Budgetüberwachung und -steuerung
Erstellung von Wirtschaftlichkeitsanalysen, Deckungsbeitragsrechnung, statistischen Meldungen und adhoc-Auswertungen
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Datenqualität, Stammdatenpflege
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen IT und Einkauf, Lager & Logistik, QS, Verkauf


Profil


Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL
Erste bis mehrjährige Erfahrung oder Praktika im Controlling und Bereich Datenanalyse
Optional: Erfahrung bei der Implementierung von KI-unterstützter Software
Ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis, Leistungsbereitschaft, Teamfähigkeit und Flexibilität
Gute Organisations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, selbständiges Arbeiten
Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse, insbesondere MS Excel
IT-Kenntnisse: SQL von Vorteil, BI-Software Qlik von Vorteil
Deutsch C1 / Englisch B1


Wir bieten

Wir bieten eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung, einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten und dynamischen Team.


Leistungsgerechte Vergütung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten Team

HTML:
Die Havelland Express Frischdienst GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches mittelständisches Unternehmen, das die gehobene Hotellerie und Gastronomie mit Lebensmitteln beliefert. Als Vollsortimenter bieten wir unseren Kunden eine große Auswahl an frischen und tiefgekühlten Produkten. Von unserem Geschäftssitz in Berlin Tempelhof aus beliefern wir unsere Kunden in ganz Deutschland, Polen, Tschechien und im Baltikum.

Zur Verstärkung unseres hochmotivierten Teams suchen wir per sofort an unserem Standort Berlin in Vollzeit eine/n Junior Controller*in / Data Analyst, (m/w/d)

Aufgaben

  • Analyse von internen und externen Daten zur Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzialen
  • Überwachung der Preis- und Erlösentwicklung
  • Budgetüberwachung und -steuerung
  • Erstellung von Wirtschaftlichkeitsanalysen, Deckungsbeitragsrechnung, statistischen Meldungen und adhoc-Auswertungen
  • Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Datenqualität, Stammdatenpflege
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen IT und Einkauf, Lager & Logistik, QS, Verkauf

Profil

  • Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL
  • Erste bis mehrjährige Erfahrung oder Praktika im Controlling und Bereich Datenanalyse
  • Optional: Erfahrung bei der Implementierung von KI-unterstützter Software
  • Ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis, Leistungsbereitschaft, Teamfähigkeit und Flexibilität
  • Gute Organisations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, selbständiges Arbeiten
  • Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse, insbesondere MS Excel
  • IT-Kenntnisse: SQL von Vorteil, BI-Software Qlik von Vorteil
  • Deutsch C1 / Englisch B1

Wir bieten

Wir bieten eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung, einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten und dynamischen Team.

  • Leistungsgerechte Vergütung
  • Moderner Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten Team
  • Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
  • Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte und Sozialleistungen
  • Regelmäßige Firmenevents
  • BVG-Zuschuss und Parkplätze vorhanden
  • Kantine und Getränkeversorgung im Unternehmen

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Data Analyst - Datenanalyse / Dashboard / Teamarbeit / Home Office (m/w/d)
Description:
Über Maniko Nails GmbH

Maniko hat die Nagellackindustrie im Sturm erobert. Unsere innovativen Nagellack-Produkte setzen neue Maßstäbe. Die hochwertigen UV-Gel-Streifen sorgen für eine makellose Maniküre, die mindestens 21 Tage hält, ohne vermalen oder absplittern. Mit einer großen Auswahl an Farben und Designs sind die Anwendungsmöglichkeiten nahezu unbegrenzt - und das Beste: Sie lassen sich im Handumdrehen auftragen und schonend entfernen. Unsere Produkte stehen für Nachhaltigkeit, denn sie sind vegan und wurden ohne Tierversuche entwickelt. Unser Ziel ist es, den herkömmlichen flüssigen Nagellack und das Nagelstudio als unangefochtenen Favoriten abzulösen und Frauen weltweit mit perfekten Nägeln zu begeistern!

Was bieten wir dir?


Extrem steile Lernkurve, kurze Entscheidungswege und direkte Zusammenarbeit mit dem online-erfahrenen Gründerteam
Die Möglichkeit, die unmittelbare Wirkung deiner Arbeit zu sehen und eine junge, aufstrebende Marke mitzugestalten
Ein schnelles, junges, dynamisches und hochmotiviertes Team im Herzen von Berlin (Hackescher Markt)
Viele Freiräume, um deine Aufgaben nach deinen Vorstellungen zu lösen
Regelmäßige Team-Events
Ein BVG-Ticket
Vollkommen flexible Arbeitszeiten


Was erwartet dich?


Du entwickelst unsere Datenlandschaft mit - vom Data Warehouse bis zum Dashboard
Du analysierst und interpretierst unsere Daten zur Unterstützung unserer Entscheidungsfindung
Du kommunizierst und präsentierst Datenanalysen und Erkenntnisse effektiv
Du arbeitest mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um gemeinsame Ziele zu erreichen


Was solltest du mitbringen?


Du hast erste Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse
Du hast eine ausgeprägte Neugier, neue Fähigkeiten zu erlernen
Du gehst strukturiert an komplexe Problemstellungen heran
Du bist ein Teamplayer:in mit ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Du hast Freude an der Arbeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld
Du hast optional Erfahrung mit SQL, Visualisierungstools, Google Sheets oder Stakeholder Management


Unser Jobangebot Data Analyst - Datenanalyse / Dashboard / Teamarbeit / Home Office (m/w/d) klingt vielversprechend?

Bei unserem Partner Workwise ist eine Bewerbung für diesen Job in nur wenigen Minuten und ohne Anschreiben möglich. Anschließend kann der Status der Bewerbung live verfolgt werden. Wir freuen wir uns auf eine Bewerbung über Workwise.

Mehr Informationen zu uns und unseren Jobangeboten findet man auf unserem Unternehmensprofil bei Workwise.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data (Risk) Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team and contribute to the development and enhancement of our portfolio risk management system.

In this role, you will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide risk decisions within the company values and expectations and be able to mitigate risks while at the same time embrace growth opportunities.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

Responsibilities


Perform in-depth portfolio data analysis from various angles (credit risk, fraud, acceptance rate and funnel) to develop a deep understanding of business processes and product, and to support risk optimisation
Design data models as part of data business warehouses to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update Portfolio management dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding portfolio performance, communicate key insights and recommendations to relevant stakeholders
Perform in-depth data analysis to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Identify and analyze potential sources of loss to minimize risk and estimate the potential financial consequences of a loss
Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio’s KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have at least 3-4 years proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative risk analytics
You have excellent proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Experience in designing KPI dashboards for all types of audiences up to C-level
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You are proficient in data visualization and analytics tools, like Tableau, Power BI, Looker
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organised, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst
Description:
Join the movement at Klim, a Berlin-based clean-tech company on a mission to transform climate protection through the widespread adoption of regenerative agriculture across Germany and Europe. Our vision is a thriving earth with a fully regenerative system that protects the world’s most precious resource: Soil.

At Klim, we've pioneered the world’s first digital platform for regenerative agriculture, empowering thousands of farmers to champion sustainable practices. We provide financial compensation to farmers for their regenerative practices and offer high-quality advisory services. We connect the farmers with forward-thinking companies who want to invest in a greener future. By purchasing the carbon credits generated from these sustainable practices or implementing regenerative agriculture in their food supply chain, these companies not only fulfill their environmental responsibilities but also fuel a cycle of positive change.

Now, we're looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to be at the forefront of change, driving impactful insights and reporting to guide and shape our company as it grows.

Backed by visionary investors like Atlantic Food Labs, Ananda Impact Ventures, and AgFunder, we're on a trajectory of growth and innovation. If you're ready to make a difference and be part of something truly meaningful, join us at Klim, and together, let's cultivate a brighter tomorrow for all.

Tasks


Analyze sales, operational, and product datasets and extract relevant insights
Work with stakeholders to design effective reporting and dashboarding; and to define and refine meaningful KPIs
Understand business logic, build context, and deliver insights in the form of analyses, recommendations, visualizations, and presentations
Contribute to the development and maintenance of robust internal data models
Perform ad-hoc requests as necessary



Requirements


Minimum three years experience in an analytics or analytics-adjacent role; or educational equivalent
Strong statistical background with intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL. Python knowledge is beneficial
Experience using Apache Superset or a similar BI tool for reporting and visualization
Experience using DBT
Excellent communication skills to relay complex findings to non-technical audiences
Comfortable working independently with loosely defined problems
Full working proficiency in English. German language skills are a plus



Benefits

Opportunity: Be part of our journey from the very beginning, working on an equal footing with the leadership team to build a new company

Impact: Make a daily and active contribution to combating climate change, promoting consumer education, and fostering fair conditions for our climate-conscious farmers

Autonomy: Take ownership of your projects and enjoy a high degree of creative freedom

Competitive package: Receive a competitive salary and have the opportunity to participate in our VSOP program

Flexible work model: At Klim, we foster a flexible, hybrid work approach and facilitate remote work (within the EU). For this role, it is important that you live in Berlin or can be present in our beautiful office on a regular basis.

Additional benefits: We offer membership in the Urban Sports Club, a company pension scheme, team lunches (if in Berlin) and regular team events

We are looking forward to meeting you! At Klim, we place great value on equal opportunities. We believe that an outstanding work environment should reflect diversity of backgrounds, talents and thoughts. Together, we grow as a team based on our individual strengths. Every personnel decision is made solely on the basis of qualifications, performance and the requirements of the company.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements




Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office

HTML:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks

  • Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
  • Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
  • Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
  • Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
  • Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
  • Define data quality standards.
  • Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.

Your Profile

  • Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
  • 4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
  • A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
  • High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
  • Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail

Your Skills

  • Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
  • Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software

We Offer

  • Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
  • No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
  • Urban Sports Membership options
  • A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
  • A modern workspace within an international tech community office
