Title: Data Analyst, Operations
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst, Operations to work with stakeholders across Member Operations and Trust & Safety. The Operations Analytics team is responsible for all metrics related to operations efficiency, cost, and longevity. It provides support with the analytical, data science, and analytics engineering capabilities required to scale reporting, forecasting, and insights around member retention, workforce management, and operational efficiency.

This is a unique opportunity for an analyst who enjoys a dynamic environment of a growing company, has experience in operational analytics and has a passion to make a positive impact on customers and the business whilst contributing to the Bumble Inc.’s mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in operations analytics at a relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of customer operations, payments and behavioural data. You will be fluent in a range of analytical techniques from data modelling, self-serve analytics, to data science and forecasting as applied to workforce management, abuse moderation, and regulatory reporting, and will have a deep understanding of operations and moderation.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Key Accountabilities


Collaborate with the member operations and trust and safety teams to generate actionable and pragmatic insights and recommendations, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
Efficiently present your information to executive stakeholders, effectively select the right visualisation types and abstract technical complexities in accessible business language.
Drive core business insights around cost to serve, average handling time, and other operational efficiencies. Design and build reporting suites relevant to the operational stakeholders using multiple domain areas across cost, operations, and business metrics.
Act as a trusted thought partner in the customer operations domain and collaborate with other areas of analytics and the business to bring to light how product and other customer initiatives impact the member support and trust and safety and vice versa.
You will act as translator between business and analyst requirements and applications to the data model.
You will optimise reporting to reflect consistency in sources of truth, and align stakeholders in your domain on definitions of metrics and dimensions.
You will work closely with your team and stakeholders in operations and trust and safety domain to support them with the most impactful priorities, reduce time to insight, ensure data quality and reliability.
You will work with advanced analytics models and methods across the core levers of operations (including experimentation, ML and automation).


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
3+ years experience in commercial/operational analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.
You have experience and knowledge of the operations domain across multiple channels, tools, and understand the tooling/vendor landscape (Zendesk, UnitQ among others) and opportunities for automation introduction of genAi.
You have had experience setting up experimentation (A/B testing), measurement, and data collection.
You have experience in building and deploying ML and statistical models for demand forecasting and segmentation.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.
You have worked with multiple data visualisation and transformation tools, with preference for DBT, Airflow, Fivetran, and Tableau/Powerbi/Looker or similar.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values.
Engaging , inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
You can manipulate large datasets, combining data from multiple sources to obtain the required results.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with Python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.You are an expert in SQL and Python and are willing to upskill teams on best practices.
You can break down and explain complex processes, requirements and data pipelines to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You’ll have demonstrable experience in presenting these solutions to your peers.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst 

Location: London - Hybrid

Department: Technology

Reporting to: Data Director

This is a full-time position based at the Time Out London office, with 2 days in the office and 3 work from home days, offering flexibility.

Role Overview

We're looking for a data analyst who is as passionate about uncovering hidden trends in the data as they are about unearthing the next hidden gem in the city.

Time Out is renowned as the global media powerhouse for all things cultural – the ultimate guide to eating, drinking, exploring, and everything in between.In addition to helping you find the best a city can offer, we are also a growing premium food hall business that brings the best of the city’s food scene under one roof that is Time Out Market.

As a unique business that straddles two seemingly different worlds (media and hospitality), our data and insight demands are bespoke. You will be fundamental to building our data-driven approach, culture and capabilities.

The perfect candidate does not exist, if you think you have experience in most of these capabilities then please consider applying.

What you'll be doing:


Dive deep into our user data from Google Analytics to understand what Time Out audiences are craving most.

Unleash your inner data ninja using BigQuery on GCP to analyse website traffic, app engagement, and user behaviour.

Dig into and uncover patterns from our Markets data to inform what are our top sellers, current food trends and how we can incorporate that in our menus

Craft beautiful and insightful Looker dashboards that tell compelling stories about our content and audience.

Collaborate with our editorial and marketing teams to translate data insights into actionable strategies.

Stay on top of the latest data analysis trends and tools to ensure we're constantly optimising our content and user experience.

What you'll bring to the party:

A minimum of 2 years' experience as a data analyst (or similar role).

An arsenal of data analysis skills, including SQL, Looker, and Google Analytics.

BigQuery on GCP – the more experience, the better (but we can train the right candidate!).

A sharp eye for detail and a talent for wrangling messy data.

An inherent curiosity with the ability to translate complex insights into actionable recommendations

A genuine love for Time Out's mission and a passion for exploring everything your city has to offer.

Bonus points if you have:

Python development experience

Experience working in the media or entertainment industry.

A knack for data visualisation and storytelling with a Time Out twist (think witty, engaging, and full of personality).

A positive attitude, collaborative spirit, and a willingness to learn and grow

About our culture

At Time Out Group we believe in diversity and equal opportunity for all people. We do not discriminate against external or internal candidates on the basis of age; disability; gender, gender reassignment; race; religion or belief; sexual orientation; marriage and civil partnership; pregnancy and maternity. We believe that diversity develops creativity and enables personal and professional growth where we all learn from each other. We believe in an open culture where ideas are shared candidly and where there is no fear of failure, but rather an understanding that we must experiment and have the freedom to succeed. We believe that everyone has the right to express themselves as they are as this enriches us all. We believe in an open world, social justice, and the pursuit of happiness, after all, we are in the happiness business.


About Time Out Group plc








Through Time Out Media and Time Out Market we help our large audience go out in the world's greatest cities and connect global brands as well as local talents with this valuable audience.

Time Out Media’s multiple digital and physical channels span websites, mobile, social media, video, audio and Live Events. Across these channels, Time Out distributes its high-quality content – curated and created by a global team of local expert journalists – around the best food, drinks, culture, art, music, theatre, travel and entertainment in 333 cities and 59 countries. The Company is giving international, national and local brands and businesses the opportunity to connect with this global reach and strong traffic from a desirable audience by offering bespoke 360-degree multichannel advertising solutions. Since its launch in 1968, Time Out has become a global brand that advertisers and consumers love and trust.

Time Out Market is the world's first editorially curated food and cultural market, leveraging the Time Out brand to bring the best of the city together under one roof: its best chefs, drinks and cultural experiences – based on the editorial curation Time Out has always been known for. The first Time Out Market opened in 2014 in Lisbon, quickly turning into one of the most popular destinations in the city. The success of Lisbon brought further expansion and the portfolio currently includes eight Markets:
in addition to Lisbon, there are sites in New York, Boston, Montreal, Chicago, Dubai, Cape Town and Porto. More Time Out Market locations are in the pipeline as the global expansion continues.




Time Out is headquartered in London (United Kingdom) and listed on London's AIM stock exchange, trading under the ticker symbol 'TMO'.




Time Out is a dynamic, pioneering brand and so is our team. We want to work with the best and brightest talent because we work for the world’s greatest cities, the people enjoying them and the businesses in them. As a truly global team we get to collaborate with colleagues from New York to Paris, Cape Town and Sydney and beyond. It’s our expertise, authenticity and collaboration that make us successful and a unique team.

HTML:
Title: Data Analyst 

Location: London - Hybrid

Department: Technology

Reporting to: Data Director

This is a full-time position based at the Time Out London office, with 2 days in the office and 3 work from home days, offering flexibility.

Role Overview

We're looking for a data analyst who is as passionate about uncovering hidden trends in the data as they are about unearthing the next hidden gem in the city.

Time Out is renowned as the global media powerhouse for all things cultural – the ultimate guide to eating, drinking, exploring, and everything in between.In addition to helping you find the best a city can offer, we are also a growing premium food hall business that brings the best of the city’s food scene under one roof that is Time Out Market.

As a unique business that straddles two seemingly different worlds (media and hospitality), our data and insight demands are bespoke. You will be fundamental to building our data-driven approach, culture and capabilities.

The perfect candidate does not exist, if you think you have experience in most of these capabilities then please consider applying.

What you'll be doing:

  • Dive deep into our user data from Google Analytics to understand what Time Out audiences are craving most.

  • Unleash your inner data ninja using BigQuery on GCP to analyse website traffic, app engagement, and user behaviour.

  • Dig into and uncover patterns from our Markets data to inform what are our top sellers, current food trends and how we can incorporate that in our menus

  • Craft beautiful and insightful Looker dashboards that tell compelling stories about our content and audience.

  • Collaborate with our editorial and marketing teams to translate data insights into actionable strategies.

  • Stay on top of the latest data analysis trends and tools to ensure we're constantly optimising our content and user experience.

What you'll bring to the party:

  • A minimum of 2 years' experience as a data analyst (or similar role).

  • An arsenal of data analysis skills, including SQL, Looker, and Google Analytics.

  • BigQuery on GCP – the more experience, the better (but we can train the right candidate!).

  • A sharp eye for detail and a talent for wrangling messy data.

  • An inherent curiosity with the ability to translate complex insights into actionable recommendations

  • A genuine love for Time Out's mission and a passion for exploring everything your city has to offer.

Bonus points if you have:

  • Python development experience

  • Experience working in the media or entertainment industry.

  • A knack for data visualisation and storytelling with a Time Out twist (think witty, engaging, and full of personality).

  • A positive attitude, collaborative spirit, and a willingness to learn and grow

About our culture

At Time Out Group we believe in diversity and equal opportunity for all people. We do not discriminate against external or internal candidates on the basis of age; disability; gender, gender reassignment; race; religion or belief; sexual orientation; marriage and civil partnership; pregnancy and maternity. We believe that diversity develops creativity and enables personal and professional growth where we all learn from each other. We believe in an open culture where ideas are shared candidly and where there is no fear of failure, but rather an understanding that we must experiment and have the freedom to succeed. We believe that everyone has the right to express themselves as they are as this enriches us all. We believe in an open world, social justice, and the pursuit of happiness, after all, we are in the happiness business.


About Time Out Group plc




Through Time Out Media and Time Out Market we help our large audience go out in the world's greatest cities and connect global brands as well as local talents with this valuable audience.

Time Out Media’s multiple digital and physical channels span websites, mobile, social media, video, audio and Live Events. Across these channels, Time Out distributes its high-quality content – curated and created by a global team of local expert journalists – around the best food, drinks, culture, art, music, theatre, travel and entertainment in 333 cities and 59 countries. The Company is giving international, national and local brands and businesses the opportunity to connect with this global reach and strong traffic from a desirable audience by offering bespoke 360-degree multichannel advertising solutions. Since its launch in 1968, Time Out has become a global brand that advertisers and consumers love and trust.

Time Out Market is the world's first editorially curated food and cultural market, leveraging the Time Out brand to bring the best of the city together under one roof: its best chefs, drinks and cultural experiences – based on the editorial curation Time Out has always been known for. The first Time Out Market opened in 2014 in Lisbon, quickly turning into one of the most popular destinations in the city. The success of Lisbon brought further expansion and the portfolio currently includes eight Markets:
in addition to Lisbon, there are sites in New York, Boston, Montreal, Chicago, Dubai, Cape Town and Porto. More Time Out Market locations are in the pipeline as the global expansion continues.


Time Out is headquartered in London (United Kingdom) and listed on London's AIM stock exchange, trading under the ticker symbol 'TMO'.


Time Out is a dynamic, pioneering brand and so is our team. We want to work with the best and brightest talent because we work for the world’s greatest cities, the people enjoying them and the businesses in them. As a truly global team we get to collaborate with colleagues from New York to Paris, Cape Town and Sydney and beyond. It’s our expertise, authenticity and collaboration that make us successful and a unique team.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - £30k-£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: £30k-£60k – London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!




Responsibilities:

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities




Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme




If the above role is of interest and you’ve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!




Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

The Independent is an online news publisher established in 1986 as a national newspaper independent of party political affiliations or proprietorial influence. In 2016, The Independent became a fully digital publisher, moving away from print in pursuit of sustainability, and to safeguard its values and journalism for the future.




The Independent is the first – and only – major newspaper to pull off a successful transformation to fully digital publishing, and Independent teams now provide services across commercial and editorial functions to a family of brands including the Evening Standard, HuffPost UK and BuzzFeed

We have an international editorial team with our main offices in London and New York.




Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We champion diversity in our teams and in our reporting. As a growing and global brand, we must have a workforce that’s more representative of our readers, viewers, clients and partners, and a workplace that creates a sense of belonging for everyone.




We are committed to hiring and developing a diverse workforce regardless of background, and we support our people to thrive in their careers here.




The Independent is an equal opportunities employer, if you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.




Job purpose

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team supporting the Evening Standard. They will be responsible for running and improving standard reports which are distributed across the business as well as ad hoc and strategic analysis to support the Standard’s digital strategy.




The successful candidate will liaise with key members of the Evening Standard Editorial, business and Audience teams daily. They will be responsible for delivering new reports and dashboards to stakeholders as required, supporting the Senior Analyst in delivering insight for teams across the Evening Standard. They will be equipped to deliver complex analysis in an engaging way to a range of stakeholders with differing levels of data literacy and present the Data Team in meetings to discuss their analysis, insight and findings. They will also help train other members of the business on the tools and software used by the Data Team.




The ideal candidate will have a self-directed, inquisitive mindset and be comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams. The right candidate will be proactive in their approach to answering ad-hoc queries with tight deadlines.




The Team

The Independent Data & Marketing department provides a centralised service in areas that include analytics, engineering and data architecture, commercial data, subscriptions and CRM strategy, registrations, customer success, design and privacy compliance.




This role sits within the Newsroom Analytics Data Team. They are responsible for supporting editors, journalists, business and audience teams. The team’s output underpins the success of the business and plays a crucial role in supporting what content the newsroom focuses on as well as finding areas of commercial opportunity. Team members also work closely with the executive team, Licensing & Syndication, financial and engineering departments.




About you

A recent graduate or someone looking for their next role in analytics.
Experience in excel or google sheets
Experience of digital analytics tools, ideally including measurement platforms such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or Chartbeat, and BI platforms such as Domo, Tableau or Looker.
A willingness to continuously improve, with an inquisitive mindset and a passion for data and analysis.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills when dealing with internal stakeholders.
Requirement to be self-motivated, highly organized and able to work to demanding deadlines.
Motivated to work in digital media.




Key responsibilities and accountabilities

Reporting to a Senior Data Analyst & working primarily on the Evening Standard business, the candidate’s key responsibilities include:




Compilation of regular reports to help editorial stakeholders monitor relevant KPIs using key data sources, specialising in social media, SEO and video analytics
Contribute to standard daily, weekly and monthly reports on website performance as well as pre- and post-event analysis for major traffic driving events.
Support the content planning and assessment process by providing editorial insight
Monitor competitors using a suite of social and SEO listening tools. Compile appropriate benchmarks to monitor performance for a variety of metrics on and off-platform.
Ensuring analysis and actionable insights for the newsroom fit with business objectives, and proactively identifying publishing trends, areas of opportunity, efficiencies and support for the changing nature of digital content publishing
Developing KPI structures and setting up dashboards
Arranging regular 1-to-1 training sessions for editorial and commercial stakeholders
Manage and maintain user access for the suite of analytics tools used across the business
Handle all data securely and responsibly, observing the Data Protection Act and Company Code of Conduct




Essential skills

Proficient using Excel / Google Sheets with relevant working experience
Comfortable presenting data-driven insights to key stakeholders through articulate communication, both in virtual meetings and in-person settings
Ability to autonomously prioritise workload effectively & meet tight deadlines from Editorial stakeholders
Strong attention to detail
Excellent problem-solving skills
Curiosity and a questioning nature
Love of data




Desirable skills

Basic SQL Experience
Experience using a Business Intelligence tool to extract, analyze, and visualize data
Understanding of SEO / Social KPIs
A keen interest in current affairs and trending topics




Our values – you will deliver across all our values.




Inclusive: We champion diversity in our teams and in our reporting. Working as a team, we put transparency and effective communication at the heart of everything we do.




Innovative: From the very beginning, The Independent has been breaking the mould. We take risks and are always looking to try new ideas in pursuit of excellence.




Independent: Nobody tells us what to think; we make up our own minds and aren’t afraid to do things differently. Like our readers, we value honesty and integrity above outside influences.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people – knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‘all in’. Our values are:




Get Smart – we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego – we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion – we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity – we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, we’re going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Show more
HTML:
About Inigo


We enable your ambition. We insure good people – knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.


Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‘all in’. Our values are:


  • Get Smart – we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
  • Park the Ego – we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
  • Share the Passion – we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
  • Radical Simplicity – we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate


Aim of the role


The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.


The successful candidate will do this by:


  • Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
  • Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
  • Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
  • Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
  • Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
  • Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
  • Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
  • Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
  • Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)


In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.


To do this, we’re going to need you to bring:


  • Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
  • Experience with dealing with large amount of data
  • High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
  • Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
  • Good problem-solving abilities

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Graduate Investment Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for 2024 graduates to join one of the most interesting and exciting investment managers in their London office for summer 2024. This is an amazing opportunity to kickstart your career in an organisation which has an inclusive culture where the contributions of all our people are recognised and valued.




At the heart of the firm's mission is the responsibility to safeguard and grow investors' capital. In alignment with investor expectations, they are dedicated to cultivating a culture that upholds the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion, alongside delivering financial returns




The Data Analytics and Business Solutions team is tasked with the capture, validation, manipulation and analysis of various investment-related datasets in order to deliver effective insights, reports, completion of targeted cross-functional projects to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk, implementation of solutions to business process challenges and provision of insights to assist with decision making. As such, candidates will gain broad exposure to various functions, teams and senior personnel including those within Investment Management, Operations, Valuation, Risk, Technology and Client Services/Reporting.




Key Responsibilities:




Management of investment attribution data.
Management of pricing feeds and validation
Development of processes to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk.
Ensuring data requirements of internal and external stakeholders (incl. recurring reports) are completed
Management of cash data and reconciliation for cash forecasting exercises.
Projection of future returns for each investment within the companies portfolios on a monthly basis.
Execution of portfolio analytics and the utilization of in-house aggregation tools to generate analytical reports.
Communication of monthly portfolio projection results to senior management and clients through monthly newsletters and bespoke reports.
Address ad-hoc portfolio-related analytical requests from investors and senior management.
Collaboration with the internal tech team in targeted cross-functional projects, offering exposure to different teams and enhancing business efficiency.




Requirements:




Drive and passion to build a career in investment management
Strong numerical degree from a reputable university.
Good IT skills, especially in Excel
Some experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and C# is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to work efficiently under pressure, delivering accurate results within strict deadlines.
Strong team mindset and excellent collaboration skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to £70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that’s fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the world’s leading luxury department stores and we’re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world’s most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we’ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, you’ll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days’ holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: £30,000 - £35,000




Join a pioneering London-based Financial Services company that is transforming the insurance landscape with innovative solutions. With a remarkable access to funding secured in the last 6 months, this Series-A funded company is poised for exponential growth and is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team.




Role Overview:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting complex data to help shape the future of financial technology. Your insights will drive key business decisions and contribute to the development of cutting-edge investment products. This position offers the flexibility of working fully remotely while being part of an exciting and fast-paced environment.




Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's from a russell group university, and a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

- Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL




Benefits:

- Performance-based bonus

- Private health and dental insurance

- Stock options

- Opportunity to work in a fully-remote position

- Be part of a fast-growing company with significant funding and growth potential




How to Apply:

If you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst looking to make a significant impact in the Financial Services industry, we would love to hear from you. Please click apply for immediate consideration

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Introduction

In this role, you will be working in our B2C function working primarily in the acquisition insights team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Accountabilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders.
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing.
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The following would also be advantageous but not required:


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you and experienced Data Analyst looking to progress your career with an exciting, dynamic and growing organisation? if so, I have a great role for you.




As part of the Data Science Team, the Data Analyst will play a key role in a variety of business intelligence and analytical projects. This role is crucial in extracting true value from our data and presenting insights in a meaningful and actionable way to the business. It is a highly visible position, frequently requiring presentations to the executive team and their leadership teams.







Main Duties and Responsibilities:




Lead and execute analytics projects using a combination of open-source and cloud tools, driving innovation and delivering actionable insights.
Work as part of a larger (scrum) team when required on larger scale projects and products.
Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs
Performs diagnosis on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis
Collaborate with product managers and designers to ensure the feasibility of product extensions and new products based on existing proprietary, quant and qual datasets
Work with outputs from Research and historical data to identify consistent and inconsistent product features and document precise requirements for improved consistency, diagnostic and explanatory power
Collaborate with designers, Tech colleagues and expert users to come up with engaging ways to visualise data and insights for non-technical audiences
Design, develop and produce novel ways to present and highlight important analysis from complex data sets, including joining across datasets which do not perfectly match
Collaborate with Product, Tech, Research and other Commercial / Internal stakeholders to understand and define new, marketable product (or extensions) from existing data
Create and present progress reports and ad-hoc analysis to the key stakeholders and teams
Constantly think about and explain to stakeholders how analytics “product” could be refined and productionised in future
Work with Tech colleagues to improve the Data Science workspace / environment, including providing requirements for Data Lake / Data Pipeline / Data Engineering colleagues
Expanding upon the internal tools and techniques that have already been developed
Be responsible for end-to-end Data Analytics lifecycle : analysis of data, from data cleaning to extracting insights and recommending production approaches
Responsible for the process of demonstrating value-add to stakeholders
Coach, guide, and nurture talent within the data science team, and wider Analytics community, enabling growth and skill development.




Person Specification:




Bachelors, Masters or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Maths, Physics, Operational Research or a related quant / STEM field
Comfortable to work with uncertainty and ambiguity, from initial concepts through iterations and conducting experiments to find the right products / services to launch
Excellent problem-solver & strong analytical skills
Proven aptitude to learn new tools, technologies, and methodologies
Understanding of requirements for software engineering and data governance in data science
Proven ability to lead and mentor data analysts across teams.
Evidence of taking an analytics team or department on a journey from simple to Advanced Analytics
Ability to translate complex analysis findings into a clear narrative and actionable insights
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to listen, and collaborate with non-technical and non-quant stakeholders
Work with client-facing and Tech teams to make sure that they fully understand the right data is being collected with sufficient quality and stored in an easy to analyse / reporting format
A good grounding in data ethics
Experience presenting analysis and insights to audiences from varying skill sets and backgrounds




Nice to have:




experience working with market research methods and market research datasets

experience in the professional services or legal sector

B2B market research would be a significant advantage




Skills and Experience:




Delivering significant and valuable advanced analytics projects and/or assets in industry and/or professional services
Proven experience in data analytics and business intelligence
Proficiency in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries.
Proficiency in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards, with advanced technical knowledge in security, and re-usability
Previous experience working with a cloud-based data platform such as Microsoft Azure
Expertise in data analysis and deriving insights from data, with the initiative to deep dive into data and present findings to stakeholders
Comfortable presenting complex ideas to executive-level and technical stakeholders

Show more

  • Proficiency in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards, with advanced technical knowledge in security, and re-usability
  • Previous experience working with a cloud-based data platform such as Microsoft Azure
  • Expertise in data analysis and deriving insights from data, with the initiative to deep dive into data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Comfortable presenting complex ideas to executive-level and technical stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst

LONDON

HYBRID - 4 DAYS IN THE OFFICE A WEEK

UP TO £50K




This role cannot sponsor




THE COMPANY

A real estate company focused utilises data for investment in property, and development of the market managing purpose-built assets focused in the Pan Europe market




THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role you will be responsible for gathering data from the investment and real estate teams, analysing it, and providing advice on areas of growth in investment real estate




In this role you will be:

Collecting, cleaning, and analysing data to help develop visually appealing dashboards in Power BI and Tableau
Collaborating with the real estate and investment team to help identify areas of growth for the company to help optimise their performance

Proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau
Proven experience in either investment analytics or real estate data
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with non-technical and technical people
Proven ability to work autonomously and manage your own projects end-to-end
Full right to work in the UK

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About the job



My client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their data team. This role will be pivotal in modeling data and constructing their internal data platform for the first time. Key responsibilities include using dbt to transform data into accurate and dynamic models for business insights and reporting. Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist in the entire data process, from digestion to visualization.



Role Requirements


Collaborate with data scientists to design, evaluate, and monitor the performance of models and algorithms.
Work with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to address client and user challenges.
Ensure accurate data collection in partnership with data engineers.
Enhance customer understanding to provide tailored solutions.
Conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data cleaning to insight extraction.
Demonstrate value to prospective clients by expanding on existing tools and techniques.
Develop innovative methods to showcase key analysis from complex data sets.
Drive product and business strategy through analytical findings.


Required Skills


2/3+ years of experience as a data analyst.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python (especially Pandas) and SQL.
Solid understanding of statistical methods.
Experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Superset, etc.
Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Knowledge of data ethics.
Ability to present analysis and insights to diverse audiences.
Strong work ethic and a thirst for knowledge.


Desired Skills


Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Fluency in statistics.
Good understanding of computer science concepts.
Domain knowledge or experience in the Financial Services industry or Fintech companies.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London 🌆




Remuneration: Hourly rate £35.58 💸




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ⌛




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ⏰




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. 📈




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. 🌟




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ✨




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.💼




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote




Description:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.




Key Skills and Experience:

Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The NHS Counter Fraud Authority (NHSCFA) is the national body responsible for all matters relating to the prevention, detection and investigation of economic crime across the NHS. Further information about our work and annual plan for delivering this is available on our website.

The Data Analyst is a role designed to provide a comprehensive information management service in support of all directorates of the organisation and external clients of the Information Analytics Team. The post holder will be responsible for delivery of the Information Analytics Business Plan, collating and organising data, and findings, across several priority projects and in response to requests from internal and external stakeholders.

Potential applicants can contact David Dixon at david.dixon@nhscfa.gov.uk for an informal chat if you have any questions regarding the role.

We reserve the right to close this vacancy before the advertised closing date should we receive a significant number of applications.

Interviews will be held on 1st/2nd August 2024.

To provide a comprehensive information management service in support of all directorates of the organisation and external clients of the Information Analytics Team. The post older will be responsible for delivery of the Information Analytics Business Plan, collating data, and findings across several priority projects and in response to requests from internal and external stakeholders.

The post holder will be required to have a NPPV2.

We have offices based in Coventry, Newcastle and London and offer flexible, hybrid, office and home-based working. In addition to the advertised salary working in the London area will attract High-Cost Area Supplement where appropriate. The NHSCFA values and respects the diversity of its employees and aims to recruit a workforce which reflects our diverse communities. We welcome applications irrespective of people's age, disability, gender, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or other personal circumstances. We have policies and procedures in place to ensure that all applicants are treated fairly and consistently at every stage of the recruitment process, including an invitation to the first stage of the selection process and consideration of reasonable adjustments for people who have a disability. If you are applying to undertake this role on a secondment basis you should have agreement to being released from your current role in principle, prior to submitting an application form. When you apply for this role, you will be redirected to our recruitment system TRAC. The NHSCFA does not hold a sponsor licence in respect of skilled worker visas and so is unable to employ candidates requiring sponsorship.

For further details / informal visits contact: Name: David Dixon Job title: Data Acquisition Manager Email address: david.dixon@nhscfa.gov.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst 📰 Digital News Media







💰 Salary: up to £32,000

🏠 Work Arrangement: Hybrid – 2 days per week in the office

📍Office: Central London







We are thrilled to partner with a prestigious digital news media company. They are seeking a Data Analyst to join their innovative Analytics Team.







🚀 This role is ideal for you if:

You want to kickstart your career in data analytics or move to an analytics role within media and would be excited to join one of the biggest media analytics teams in the UK.
You are passionate about combining maths and data.
You appreciate working in an environment that values independent thought, innovation, and diversity.
You have an interest in media and journalism







🔍 What are we looking for in the ideal candidate?

Experience using digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Looker (Or Tableau)
Proficient in maths and Excel.
A people person, willing to learn and able to thrive under pressure.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with various internal teams.







📈 Here’s what your role will entail:

You will run, improve and deliver weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reports for the internal team
Analyse data related to digital media, such as SEO, Social Media, Social Listening, Video Analytics, and Digital Analytics.
Work with the internal teams to brief them on digital performance and the latest trends.
You will represent the data team with non-technical teams.







🌱 Opportunity for growth

You can work within a large analytics team and will have opportunities to move up in role and seniority.
You can learn technical skills from other people in the team, with the opportunity to practice them in your role
You can work directly with the Head and Director of analytics and will have a chance to communicate with senior leaders.
You will have access to the latest technologies and platforms in the digital space.







📨 Are you ready to embark on a career path that blends data analytics with the fast-paced world of digital media?







Apply here!







⚖️ Equal Opportunities

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. In accordance with the Equality Act 2010, we aim to create an environment where everyone can utilize their skills fully, free from discrimination or harassment, and where decisions are based solely on merit. We ensure no individual is treated less favorably on any discriminatory grounds, including age, disability, gender reassignment, marital status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - £45-55k - London/Hybrid




This digital production house that specialise in gaming are looking for their first in-house Data Analyst to join the business. They work with tech companies to provide data-driven insights and analytics that enhance player experiences and optimise game performance.




What will you be doing?




Collaborate daily with developers to apply and test analytics libraries.
Present metrics and analyses to guide smart game development decisions.
Use SQL, R, and Tableau to answer customer questions and dive deep into data.
Work with partner analytics teams at a top tech company.
Monitor key metrics like user retention and content update impact.
Build dashboards to visualise metrics and analytics.
Report on issues, analytics results and quality status.
Leverage game feature knowledge and player behavior insights for improvements.




Skills needed:




SQL experience & understanding of relational databases
Experience with a data visualisation tools like Tableau, Microstrategy, or Power BI
Games industry experience - supporting game development/release/live ops
Passion for gaming
Ideally some game development experience - typescript proficiency or C++ etc.
Strong communication skills & collaborative mindset




If you are passionate about gaming and have the necessary skills and experience, I'd love to hear from you!




Apply now and I'll be in touch to arrange an initial call to talk through the details.




Please note that all applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
ESG Data Analyst - Data Science - Investment Management - up to £110,000




Our client, a leading Investment Management organisation based in the City of London, are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. You will be joining the ESG Data team and assist in the development of a Data Science model.




The successful candidate will be responsible for progressing the automation of ESG data production, analysis and systematic integration with other systems currently being utilised by the business. Alongside this, you will be enhancing ESG data through improving data quality and transparency as well as devising innovative approaches for ESG data analytics and insights through building robust data orientated solutions in Python.




The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and demonstrate strong problem solving skills. You will also have experience working within Investment Management or a similarly regulated industry.




Key Skills:

3-7 years experience working as an ESG Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of Python and building data orientated solutions for businesses.
Knowledge of ESG metrics is highly beneficial.
Experience working with modern data tools (e.g. Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas etc.)
Exposure to machine learning approaches such as neural networks and generative AI is desirable
Experienced working in the Investment Management industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about the world of finance and trading? Do you have a knack for numbers and a love for problem-solving? If so, MillerMaxwell have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are assisting a globally recognised firm, known for their innovative approach to electronic trading. A wide variety of their advanced tools and strategies have been helping institutions around the world to reduce transaction costs and improve investment performance for over 50 years.




What’s in it for you?

Be part of a team of experienced quants and algorithmic developers.
Get involved in a variety of tasks, from analysing market microstructure to overseeing key performance metrics for algo performance.
Opportunity to work on the conceptual and programmatic development of cutting-edge algorithms and analytics applications.
Front office role with interaction with traders and external clients.




Key Responsibilities:

Detailed analysis of market parameters and trading components.
Research into the prediction of market liquidity.
Analysis and implementation of potential new trading strategies.
Programming and delivering bespoke solutions for internal and external clients.




What we’re looking for:

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Good organizational skills and ability to oversee meetings with senior managers and other teams.
Some prior experience with programming languages (Python preferred).
Familiarity with database structures and large query optimization.
Understand and reasonable usage of data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Qlik or similar.
Experience with the analysis of large financial data sets.
Understanding and reasonable usage of data visualization tools.
Great team player with excellent command of the English language.
Able to work independently and solve and prioritize problems under time pressure.




If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and make a real impact in the world of finance, apply today! This is more than just a job - it’s a chance to shape the future of trading. Don’t miss out on this exciting opportunity! 🚀

We are assisting a globally recognised firm, known for their innovative approach to electronic trading. A wide variety of their advanced tools and strategies have been helping institutions around the world to reduce transaction costs and improve investment performance for over 50 years.


What’s in it for you?

  • Be part of a team of experienced quants and algorithmic developers.
  • Get involved in a variety of tasks, from analysing market microstructure to overseeing key performance metrics for algo performance.
  • Opportunity to work on the conceptual and programmatic development of cutting-edge algorithms and analytics applications.
  • Front office role with interaction with traders and external clients.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Detailed analysis of market parameters and trading components.
  • Research into the prediction of market liquidity.
  • Analysis and implementation of potential new trading strategies.
  • Programming and delivering bespoke solutions for internal and external clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are delighted to be working with a global specialist Insurance firm that are looking to expand there analytics team with an experienced Data analyst.




This company are experts across various areas within insurance and reinsurance and are becoming a go to household name within the sector, they have rapidly expanded and brought in 10,000+ new employees globally in the last 4 years.




Responsibilities:




Use data to solve problems and identify new opportunities.
Develop insights and create case studies for clients.
Oversee data needs for new business proposals.
Quickly transform data into actionable insights using specialized tools.
Address and monitor data-related queries.
Analyze data to detect trends.
Implement processes and systems for better data management.
Explore innovative methods for data utilization.
Work with data teams across the organization, including IT.

4+ years experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience in the Insurance industry

Proficiency in MS Excel, Python, SQL and/or R, Databricks.
Expertise in PowerBI or other visualization tools.
Engaging and inquisitive personality with problem-solving skills.
Strong business acumen, arithmetic skills, and intellectual curiosity.
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Experience in good practice UX/UI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years’ worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.


What We're Looking For In Our Applicants


Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits


Competitive holiday allowance
Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
Flexible working patterns
Workplace Pension Scheme
Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Referral Bonus Scheme
Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)
Show more
